metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3092 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The MultipartStream class in Apache Commons Fileupload before 1.3.2, as used in Apache Tomcat 7.x before 7.0.70, 8.x before 8.0.36, 8.5.x before 8.5.3, and 9.x before 9.0.0.M7 and other products, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via a long boundary string. It was discovered that the Tomcat Fileupload library incorrectly handled certain upload requests. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3092` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcommons-fileupload-java - 1.3.2-1
No subscription required

libtomcat9-embed-java - 9.0.16-3
libtomcat9-java - 9.0.16-3
tomcat9 - 9.0.16-3
tomcat9-admin - 9.0.16-3
tomcat9-common - 9.0.16-3
tomcat9-examples - 9.0.16-3
tomcat9-user - 9.0.16-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libcommons-fileupload-java package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.2-1').
tomcat9 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.0.16-3').
